name: St. Flavian of Constantinople

locations.description: Patriarch of Constantinople, martyred for defending orthodoxy

summary: Flavian was the Patriarch of Constantinople from 446 to 449. He was a defender of orthodox Christology and opposed the Monophysite teachings of Eutyches. At the 'Robber Council' of Ephesus in 449, he was deposed and physically attacked, dying shortly after from his injuries. He is considered a martyr for the faith. The Council of Chalcedon (451) vindicated his memory and restored his reputation.
